p: Similarly, we obtained mean log10 absolute fitness values (Figure 2) for each random population (RndA: 10.51 ± 0.05 s.d.m.; RndB: 10.27 ± 0.135 s.d.m.; RndC: 10.180 ± 0.14 s.d.m.; RndD: 10.19 ± 0.14 s.d.m.; RndE: 10.23 ± 0.14 s.d.m. log10 PFU/ml). We then compared the dataset for each population to the mean fitness of its founding ancestral gene pool (9.57 ± 0.29 s.d.m. log10 PFU/ml). This statistical analysis showed that all five of these populations evolved increased fitness at 40°C relative to their common ancestor (File S4).
